intro: Corydalis verticillaris subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cirnus, is a member of the Fumariaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers and slender stems. Native to the mountainous regions of East Asia, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, often pink or purple flowers in late spring. Its botanical features make it a desirable addition to rock gardens and shaded borders.
